input_text.Prompt:
Using the item keywords and item title, write a copy that follows the AIDA framework (Attention, Interest, Desire, Action) for a product or service. The copy should be concise, catchy, and persuasive.

Item title:
Virbac Petrodex 51201 Enzymatic Toothpaste for Dogs - Beef Flavor

Item keywords:
Formulated specifically for dogs
Does not foam
Controls plaque
Fights bad breath
Beef and poultry flavors
input_text.Response A:
Enzymatic Toothpaste for Dogs
 Virbac Petrodex 51201 Beef Flavor Enzymatic Toothpaste controls plaque and fights bad breath for dogs. The non-foaming formula makes it easy to mix into a cup of water for a drink. It can also be used as a dip for favorite toys. The beef flavor will make this an easy transition for any dog not accustomed to dental products. This toothpaste is formulated specifically for dogs and is a great start to getting your dog on a regular dental routine.
input_text.Response B: Petrodex Enzymatic Toothpaste for Dogs is a veterinarian-recommended, enzymatic toothpaste that is specially formulated for dogs. It does not foam, and contains enzymes that control plaque and fight bad breath. Available in beef and poultry flavors, your dog will love the taste! This product is made in the USA.

label_annotations.factors_a: A came up with strange uses for dog toothpaste (mixing in water for a drink, using as a dip)
label_annotations.factors_b: Could not verify it was made in the USA by googling, so may not be factually correct. Not sure it's detailed enough to fit the requested AIDA framework
label_annotations.feedback: wish there was a scale for when the response invents new things not stated in the prompt that may not be "factual" claims but are odd/unexpected
